text: Timothy Brown (February 24, 1889December 31, 1977) was an American lawyer and judge from Wisconsin. He was the 18th Chief Justice of the Wisconsin Supreme Court.Google books State of Wisconsin Blue Book Timothy Brown ==Biography== Born in Madison, Wisconsin, Brown graduated from the University of Wisconsin- Madison and received his law degree from Harvard Law School. During World War I, Brown served in the United States Navy. Brown practiced law in Milwaukee, Wisconsin and served as executive counsel to the Governor of Wisconsin.Google books Wisconsin Session Laws, Volume 2. Timothy Brown In 1949, he joined the Wisconsin Supreme Court and in 1962 became chief justice of the court, retiring in 1964. Wicourts.govWisconsin Historical Society Brown died in a nursing home on December 31, 1977, leaving an estate valued at $3 million. ==Notes== Category:Politicians from Madison, Wisconsin Category:Politicians from Milwaukee Category:Military personnel from Madison, Wisconsin Category:University of Wisconsin-Madison alumni Category:Harvard Law School alumni Category:Chief Justices of the Wisconsin Supreme Court Category:1889 births Category:1977 deaths Category:20th-century American judges Category:Lawyers from Milwaukee Category:Lawyers from Madison, Wisconsin
title: Timothy Brown (judge)
